query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
1 Sì tosto come l’ultima parola 2 la benedetta fiamma per dir tolse, 3 a rotar cominciò la santa mola;
query.error: **English:** 1 As soon as the last word 2 the blessed flame took to say, 3 the holy millstone began to turn;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
4 e nel suo giro tutta non si volse 5 prima ch’un’altra di cerchio la chiuse, 6 e moto a moto e canto a canto colse;
query.error: **English:** 4 and in its circling it did not fully turn 5 before another circle enclosed it, 6 and movement to movement and song to song it gathered;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
7 canto che tanto vince nostre muse, 8 nostre serene in quelle dolci tube, 9 quanto primo splendor quel ch’e’ refuse.
query.error: **English:** 7 a song that so surpasses our muses, 8 our sirens in those sweet trumpets, 9 as the first splendor surpasses that which it rejects.
query.result: 7 kanow a wra gwellhevel moy an myusi ni, 8 an syrennow ni y'n an trompow melyon hyn, 9 kevel an splannder kynsa an splannder a wra'y gwrthynna.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
10 Come si volgon per tenera nube 11 due archi paralelli e concolori, 12 quando Iunone a sua ancella iube,
query.error: **English:** 10 As through a tender cloud two bows 11 parallel and of the same color turn, 12 when Juno commands her handmaid,
query.result: 10 Kevel dell yw trohevel a-dreus kowlennow tyner 11 dew ark paralek ha'gas an keth liw, 12 pan a lever Iunon dhe'y morvoren,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
13 nascendo di quel d’entro quel di fori, 14 a guisa del parlar di quella vaga 15 ch’amor consunse come sol vapori,
query.error: **English:** 13 the one on the outside being born from the one on the inside, 14 in the manner of the speech of that fair one 15 whom love consumed like the sun consumes vapors,
query.result: 13 an onan a-ves a'n onan a-dhiwedh, 14 kevel lavarow an onan melyon hyn 15 a wra karanteth gans karanteth gans an karanteth,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
16 e fanno qui la gente esser presaga, 17 per lo patto che Dio con Noè puose, 18 del mondo che già mai più non s’allaga:
query.error: **English:** 16 and here they make people prescient, 17 because of the pact that God made with Noah, 18 that the world will never again be flooded:
query.result: 16 ha'gas wra hynma an dus presadow, 17 rag an konvenans a wra gwrys gans Duw dhe Noe, 18 namna an bys nyns yw dhe vosa moy.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
19 così di quelle sempiterne rose 20 volgiensi circa noi le due ghirlande, 21 e sì l’estrema a l’intima rispuose.
query.error: **English:** 19 so around us the two garlands 20 of those eternal roses turned, 21 and so the outermost responded to the innermost.
query.result: 19 Kevel henna an rosow sempiternel hyn 20 a wra trohevel a-dro dhe ni an dew gorlann, 21 ha'gas an onan a-ves a wra leverel dhe'n onan a-dhiwedh.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
22 Poi che ’l tripudio e l’altra festa grande, 23 sì del cantare e sì del fiammeggiarsi 24 luce con luce gaudïose e blande,
query.error: **English:** 22 After the dancing and the other great festivity, 23 both of the singing and of the flaming, 24 light with light joyful and gentle,
query.result: 22 Wosa an dans ha'n goel festa meur, 23 keth a'n kanna ha'n flammow, 24 golow gans golow lowen ha melyon,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
25 insieme a punto e a voler quetarsi, 26 pur come li occhi ch’al piacer che i move 27 conviene insieme chiudere e levarsi;
query.error: **English:** 25 together at the right moment and at the will to be quiet, 26 just like the eyes that at the pleasure that moves them 27 must close and open together;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
28 del cor de l’una de le luci nove 29 si mosse voce, che l’ago a la stella 30 parer mi fece in volgermi al suo dove;
query.error: **English:** 28 from the heart of one of the new lights 29 a voice moved, which made the needle seem to me 30 like a star in turning to its place;
query.result: 28 a galon unan a'n golow nowydh 29 a wra movys lavar, a wra gwrys an nodhel dhe'n steren 30 dhe leverel dhe'y le orth y'n fen.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
31 e cominciò: «L’amor che mi fa bella 32 mi tragge a ragionar de l’altro duca 33 per cui del mio sì ben ci si favella.
query.error: **English:** 31 and it began: “The love that makes me beautiful 32 draws me to speak of the other leader 33 through whom my leader is spoken of so well.
query.result: 31 Ha'y dhallathas: “An karanteth a wra'm melyon 32 a wra'm tynna dhe leverel a'n tywysog erel 33 rag an keth a wra leverys a'n tywysog ow yn-ta.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
34 Degno è che, dov’ è l’un, l’altro s’induca: 35 sì che, com’ elli ad una militaro, 36 così la gloria loro insieme luca.
query.error: **English:** 34 It is fitting that where one is, the other should be brought in: 35 so that, just as they fought together, 36 so their glory may shine together.
query.result: 34 Dyg yw, le mayth yw unn, an erel dhe vos gwrys: 35 marnas, kevel orth unn a wra'th dhe vresel, 36 kevel henna aga glowr a wra sklerel yn-mes.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
37 L’essercito di Cristo, che sì caro 38 costò a rïarmar, dietro a la ’nsegna 39 si movea tardo, sospeccioso e raro,
query.error: **English:** 37 The army of Christ, which cost so dear 38 to rearm, behind the standard 39 moved slowly, hesitant and sparse,
query.result: 37 An sojorya a'n Krist, a wra gans ker 38 dhe'y arvera, wosa an baner 39 a wra movyans a-dhiwedhes, dowtus ha pur,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
40 quando lo ’mperador che sempre regna 41 provide a la milizia, ch’era in forse, 42 per sola grazia, non per esser degna;
query.error: **English:** 40 when the emperor who always reigns 41 provided for the army, which was in doubt, 42 by grace alone, not because it was worthy;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
43 e, come è detto, a sua sposa soccorse 44 con due campioni, al cui fare, al cui dire 45 lo popol disvïato si raccorse.
query.error: **English:** 43 and, as it is said, he came to the aid of his bride 44 with two champions, by whose deeds and words 45 the straying people were brought back together.
query.result: 43 ha, kevel yw leverys, dhe'y spous a wra gwrys skoes 44 gans dew kampyon, rag aga ober, rag aga lavar 45 an dus a wra disvyys a wra gwrys dhe vos onan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
46 In quella parte ove surge ad aprire 47 Zefiro dolce le novelle fronde 48 di che si vede Europa rivestire,
query.error: **English:** 46 In that part where Zephyr rises to open 47 the new leaves 48 with which Europe is seen to be reclothed,
query.result: 46 Y'n an rann hyn le mayth Zefir a wra leverel dhe agora 47 an deliow nowydh melyon 48 a wra gweles Europa dhe vos gwiskes,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
49 non molto lungi al percuoter de l’onde 50 dietro a le quali, per la lunga foga, 51 lo sol talvolta ad ogne uom si nasconde,
query.error: **English:** 49 not far from the beating of the waves 50 behind which, because of the long pursuit, 51 the sun sometimes hides from every man,
query.result: 49 nyns oedh moy bell dhe'n golpya an tonnow 50 wosa henna, rag an hir brys, 51 an howl a wra'n gweles moyth dhe bub den,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
52 siede la fortunata Calaroga 53 sotto la protezion del grande scudo 54 in che soggiace il leone e soggioga:
query.error: **English:** 52 sits fortunate Calaroga 53 under the protection of the great shield 54 in which the lion is subject and subjugates:
query.result: 52 a wra sevel an Kalaroga lowen 53 a-ji dhe'n difens a'n skoed meur 54 y'n keth an leon a wra sojya ha sojya:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
55 dentro vi nacque l’amoroso drudo 56 de la fede cristiana, il santo atleta 57 benigno a’ suoi e a’ nemici crudo;
query.error: **English:** 55 within it was born the loving lover 56 of the Christian faith, the holy athlete 57 kind to his own and cruel to his enemies;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
58 e come fu creata, fu repleta 59 sì la sua mente di viva vertute 60 che, ne la madre, lei fece profeta.
query.error: **English:** 58 and as he was created, so was he filled 59 with such living virtue 60 that, in his mother, it made her a prophet.
query.result: 58 ha kevel oedh kreys, oedh leun 59 y'n poynt gans vertu byw 60 a wra gwrys, y'n y vam, profet.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
61 Poi che le sponsalizie fuor compiute 62 al sacro fonte intra lui e la Fede, 63 u’ si dotar di mutüa salute,
query.error: **English:** 61 After the marriage vows were completed 62 at the sacred font between him and Faith, 63 where they endowed each other with mutual salvation,
query.result: 61 Wosa an sponsalizie fue kompute 62 dhe'n sakro font intra ev hag an Fede, 63 u' sy dotar a vytya salus,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
64 la donna che per lui l’assenso diede, 65 vide nel sonno il mirabile frutto 66 ch’uscir dovea di lui e de le rede;
query.error: **English:** 64 the lady who gave her consent for him, 65 saw in a dream the miraculous fruit 66 that was to come from him and his descendants;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
67 e perché fosse qual era in costrutto, 68 quinci si mosse spirito a nomarlo 69 del possessivo di cui era tutto.
query.error: **English:** 67 and so that it would be as it was in construction, 68 a spirit moved from here to name him 69 with the possessive of which he was all.
query.result: 67 hag rag bosse kwal era yn kostrukt, 68 kwynsi sy mosas speris dhe'n nomarlo 69 a'n possessivo a gui era tuto.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
70 Domenico fu detto; e io ne parlo 71 sì come de l’agricola che Cristo 72 elesse a l’orto suo per aiutarlo.
query.error: **English:** 70 He was called Dominic; and I speak of him 71 as of the farmer whom Christ 72 chose in his garden to help him.
query.result: 70 Domynek o veu gelwys; ha my a wra 71 owth leverel avel an gwerthvos 72 a dhewisas Krist dhe'y arloedh rag y skoedhy.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
73 Ben parve messo e famigliar di Cristo: 74 che ’l primo amor che ’n lui fu manifesto, 75 fu al primo consiglio che diè Cristo.
query.error: **English:** 73 He seemed well a messenger and servant of Christ: 74 for the first love that was manifest in him, 75 was at the first counsel that Christ gave.
query.result: 73 Ben par hemma govys ha govyth Krist: 74 rag an kynsa karanteth a veu dyworth ynno, 75 veu dhe’n kynsa kynghor a roos Krist.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
76 Spesse fïate fu tacito e desto 77 trovato in terra da la sua nutrice, 78 come dicesse: ‘Io son venuto a questo’.
query.error: **English:** 76 Often he was found silent and awake 77 on the ground by his nurse, 78 as if to say: ‘I have come for this’.
query.result: 76 Spesse fyth veu mudh ha diwydh 77 kavos war an nor gans y vythres, 78 avel orth y leverel: ‘My a dheuth rag hemma’.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
79 Oh padre suo veramente Felice! 80 oh madre sua veramente Giovanna, 81 se, interpretata, val come si dice!
query.error: **English:** 79 Oh his father truly happy! 80 Oh his mother truly Joan, 81 if, interpreted, it is worth as much as is said!
query.result: 79 O tas ow bennathas lowen! 80 O mam ow bennathas Jowan, 81 mar, dallethys, yw gwir an lavar!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
82 Non per lo mondo, per cui mo s’affanna 83 di retro ad Ostïense e a Taddeo, 84 ma per amor de la verace manna
query.error: **English:** 82 Not for the world, for which now they toil 83 behind Ostiense and Taddeo, 84 but for love of the true manna
query.result: 82 Nyns rag an bys, rag yw poos owth poen, 83 wosa Ostiense ha Taddeo, 84 mes rag karanteth an vonna gwir.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
85 in picciol tempo gran dottor si feo; 86 tal che si mise a circüir la vigna 87 che tosto imbianca, se ’l vignaio è reo.
query.error: **English:** 85 in a short time he became a great doctor; 86 so much so that he set out to go around the vineyard 87 that quickly turns white, if the vine-dresser is bad.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
88 E a la sedia che fu già benigna 89 più a’ poveri giusti, non per lei, 90 ma per colui che siede, che traligna,
query.error: **English:** 88 And for the seat that was once kind 89 to the just poor, not for itself, 90 but for him who sits there, who degenerates,
query.result: 88 Ha'n sedh o veu unnik bys 89 dhe'n beurow just, nyns ragti, 90 mes rag an neb a-sit eno, hag a wra drog.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
91 non dispensare o due o tre per sei, 92 non la fortuna di prima vacante, 93 non decimas, quae sunt pauperum Dei,

query.result: 91 Nyns a wynn ev dhe daskorhe dhew rag whegh, 92 nag an jentyn a'n kynsa gwag, 93 nag degow, an peth yw dledhek dhe Dhew,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
94 addimandò, ma contro al mondo errante 95 licenza di combatter per lo seme 96 del qual ti fascian ventiquattro piante.
query.error: **English:** 94 but asked for license to fight against the erring world 95 for the seed 96 of which twenty-four plants make a garland for you.
query.result: 94 mes ev a wynn, orth an bys ow poos, 95 les dhe janjya rag an had 96 a-ugh dheugens planntys a wra goron dhys.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
97 Poi, con dottrina e con volere insieme, 98 con l’officio appostolico si mosse 99 quasi torrente ch’alta vena preme;
query.error: **English:** 97 Then, with learning and with will together, 98 with the apostolic office he moved 99 like a torrent that a high spring drives;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
100 e ne li sterpi eretici percosse 101 l’impeto suo, più vivamente quivi 102 dove le resistenze eran più grosse.
query.error: **English:** 100 and he struck the heretical thickets 101 with his impetus, more vigorously there 102 where the resistance was strongest.
query.result: 100 ha'n splannow eretek ev a daras 101 y'n nerth, moyha byw ynno 102 le may feur an gwrysow moyha.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
103 Di lui si fecer poi diversi rivi 104 onde l’orto catolico si riga, 105 sì che i suoi arbuscelli stan più vivi.
query.error: **English:** 103 From him then flowed diverse streams 104 with which the Catholic garden is watered, 105 so that its shrubs stand more lively.
query.result: 103 A-dhyworth ev y feu lies dyffrans 104 rag aga an ort katolik yw dowr, 105 kepar ha bos y'n prennow moy byw.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
106 Se tal fu l’una rota de la biga 107 in che la Santa Chiesa si difese 108 e vinse in campo la sua civil briga,
query.error: **English:** 106 If such was one wheel of the chariot 107 in which the Holy Church defended herself 108 and won her civil strife in the field,
query.result: 106 Mar henna veu unn a'n dhew golgh a'n kar 107 yn aga an Eglos Sans owth difenn, 108 ha'n mayn owth kolla y'n stryf sivil,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
109 ben ti dovrebbe assai esser palese 110 l’eccellenza de l’altra, di cui Tomma 111 dinanzi al mio venir fu sì cortese.
query.error: **English:** 109 it should be very clear to you 110 the excellence of the other, of which Thomas 111 was so courteous to me before my coming.
query.result: 109 yth wra dhe dhys dhe weles yn klear 110 an excellens a'n nessa, a-ugh Tommas 111 veu dhe'm bys owth karow bys owth dos.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
112 Ma l’orbita che fé la parte somma 113 di sua circunferenza, è derelitta, 114 sì ch’è la muffa dov’ era la gromma.
query.error: **English:** 112 But the orbit that made the highest part 113 of its circumference is abandoned, 114 so that there is mold where there was the eyelet.
query.result: 112 Mes an fordh a wrug an rann ughella 113 a'y golgh, yw trehedhys, 114 kepar ha bos an mof le may o'n gromma.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
115 La sua famiglia, che si mosse dritta 116 coi piedi a le sue orme, è tanto volta, 117 che quel dinanzi a quel di retro gitta;
query.error: **English:** 115 His family, that moved straight 116 with its feet in his footsteps, is so turned around, 117 that the one in front kicks the one behind;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
118 e tosto si vedrà de la ricolta 119 de la mala coltura, quando il loglio 120 si lagnerà che l’arca li sia tolta.
query.error: **English:** 118 and soon the harvest 119 of the bad cultivation will be seen, when the darnel 120 will complain that the threshing floor is taken from it.
query.result: 118 ha byghan a wra gweles an edhom 119 a'n droeth kolji, pan wra'n logel 120 owth kowsya bos an arek owth kemeras dhodho.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
121 Ben dico, chi cercasse a foglio a foglio 122 nostro volume, ancor troveria carta 123 u’ leggerebbe “I’ mi son quel ch’i’ soglio”;
query.error: **English:** 121 I say indeed, that whoever should search leaf by leaf 122 our volume, would still find a page 123 where he would read “I am what I am wont to be”;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
124 ma non fia da Casal né d’Acquasparta, 125 là onde vegnon tali a la scrittura, 126 ch’uno la fugge e altro la coarta.
query.error: **English:** 124 but it will not be from Casale nor from Acquasparta, 125 whence such people come to the writing, 126 that one flees from it and another restricts it.
query.result: 124 mes nyns yw a Gasal nag a'n Akwasparta, 125 le may yth teves an pareth dhe'n skrif, 126 unn owth foga dhodho ha'n aral owth stenja.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
127 Io son la vita di Bonaventura 128 da Bagnoregio, che ne’ grandi offici 129 sempre pospuosi la sinistra cura.
query.error: **English:** 127 I am the life of Bonaventure 128 from Bagnoregio, who in the great offices 129 always put aside the care for the left.
query.result: 127 My yw bywnans Bonaventura 128 a Vanerow, neb yn an offisow brassa 129 ev a wrug byth pospya an gowesow klew.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
130 Illuminato e Augustin son quici, 131 che fuor de’ primi scalzi poverelli 132 che nel capestro a Dio si fero amici.
query.error: **English:** 130 Illuminato and Augustine are here, 131 who were among the first barefoot poor men 132 who in the capuche made themselves friends with God.
query.result: 130 Illuminato ha Awstin yw ama, 131 a veu ynter an kynsa beurow drog 132 a wrug yn an kapester frendys gans Dhew.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
133 Ugo da San Vittore è qui con elli, 134 e Pietro Mangiadore e Pietro Spano, 135 lo qual giù luce in dodici libelli;
query.error: **English:** 133 Hugh of Saint Victor is here with them, 134 and Peter Comestor and Peter of Spain, 135 who now shines in twelve books;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
136 Natàn profeta e ’l metropolitano 137 Crisostomo e Anselmo e quel Donato 138 ch’a la prim’ arte degnò porre mano.
query.error: **English:** 136 Nathan the prophet and the metropolitan 137 Chrysostom and Anselm and that Donatus 138 who deigned to put his hand to the first art.
query.result: 136 Natan an profwydh ha'n metropolitan 137 Crisostomo ha Anselm ha'n Donatus na 138 a wrug an kynsa art yn vyth.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
139 Rabano è qui, e lucemi dallato 140 il calavrese abate Giovacchino 141 di spirito profetico dotato.
query.error: **English:** 139 Rabanus is here, and beside me shines 140 the Calabrian abbot Joachim 141 endowed with prophetic spirit.
query.result: 139 Rabano yw ena, ha'm golow 140 an abad Calabrian, Giovacchino 141 gans spyrys profwydh.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
142 Ad inveggiar cotanto paladino 143 mi mosse l’infiammata cortesia 144 di fra Tommaso e ’l discreto latino;
query.error: **English:** 142 To inspire such a bold undertaking 143 the ardent courtesy of Brother Thomas moved me, 144 and the wise Latin of Albert;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
145 e mosse meco questa compagnia».
query.error: **English:** 145 and this company moved with me.
query.result: 145 ha'n gevren ma gans an fordh magh.
